decisionMechanism

Class DecisionMechanism

  • java.lang.Object
    • decisionMechanism.DecisionMechanism

  • public class DecisionMechanism
extends java.lang.Object
    Main controlling class of all decision calculations. The mechanism has to be updated by the ScenarioController in case a Scenario is added, deleted, or has changed. The mechanism keeps for every user/role Scenario (this includes not the ideal algorithm scenarios) a Decider, which manages the scenario specific calculations and provides a high score.

    • Field Summary

      private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Decider> deciderTable
      This table keeps a Decider for each user Scenario.

    • Field Detail

      • deciderTable

        private final java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Decider> deciderTable
        This table keeps a Decider for each user Scenario. The key String is the user scenarios ID.

        Constructor of the decision mechanism.

    • Method Detail

      • addScenario

        public void addScenario(Scenario scenario)
        This should be called by the ScenarioController, if a new Scenario was created. The mechanism will create a new Decider for the scenario.
        Parameters:
        scenario -

      • criterionActivationChange

        public void criterionActivationChange(java.lang.String scenarioID,
                             java.lang.String criterionID,
                             boolean active)
        This should be called by the ScenarioController, if a Criterion of a Scenario with the passed scenario ID has changed its activation status. A criterion was activated or deactivated. An deactivated criterion has to be excluded from calculation, and an activated has to be included.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID -
        criterionID -
        active -

      • deleteScenario

        public void deleteScenario(java.lang.String scenarioID)
        This should be called by the ScenarioController, if a Scenario was deleted. This will delete the corresponding Decider.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID -

      • getDecider

        public Decider getDecider(java.lang.String scenario)

      • updateScenario

        public void updateScenario(java.lang.String scenarioID,
                  Criterion changedCriterion)
        This should be called by the ScenarioController, if a Criterion of a Scenario with the passed scenario ID has changed. This will adjust the distances from the user scenario to each algorithm scenario.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - the ID of the user Scenario
        changedCriterion -
